summary: Haunted by the mysterious death of his wife, Jeremiah Ecks (Antonio Banderas) has become a recluse, but the former FBI manhunter is blackmailed back into service to track down an unstoppable ex-DIA operative, code-named Sever (Lucy Liu), who has kidnapped the young son of the head of a secret committee of international security agencies.

this movie was so good that i literally shat out tears for 2 morbillion hours, i could feel the movie spirit coming inside of me
I've never understood why this movie is so overwhelmingly panned. Far from a masterpiece, but entirely watchable. It may even be top tier as far as video game adaptations go.
If I could give it 0 stars I would

BEST MOVIE EVER!!!! A cinematic masterpiece that deserves a spot next to Lord of the Rings and other classics. A must-watch for anyone.
if i could give 0 i would
My god this movie is so bad and boring and people say this movie is great your wrong is a terrible action movie and it totally rip off 1999 action hit film The Matrix.
Honestly, the movie was unintendedly funny. Terrible VFX making it one of the greatest comedies of all time
I thought torture was outlawed by the Geneva Convention in 1949 but Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever proves that atrocities like these are far from over.

I saw this last night, and all I got in my mind was; "Oh my GOD! The plot twist, the action, adrenaline rush and everything!" But then my mind started asking a question like; "What the...? How does it get a rotten score?!"  This movie was excellent, but obviously lazy eyes brains can't handle it. I enjoyed this with myself paying close attention and thought this was just excellent as any other action film I've seen. Too bad the disliking went too far.
Ai lại có thể làm ra một bộ phim như thế này
What do you mean? I loved it!

An unwatchable mess of a film! Bonkers senseless action, bad directing, bad pacing, bad editing, and a total waste of talent. Left me wondering "what the hell were the stars THINKING?"
Well, here's a full cliché story of an FBI agent (agaaiinn) and a DIA agent (that's new) in mortal conflict, who work together to defeat someone trying to end the human race (why would you do that? Don't you have family??? Besides, you'll kill yoursel_ oh nevermind).
So, you can easily guess how bad this was gonna be, and the person who doesn't read reviews before watching can tell how bad it is by the TITLE. Like WHAT does BALLISTIC: ECKS VS. SEVER mean? It sounds more like a bad shark movie!
Anyways, Banderas and Liu look cool, but everything is ruined in the action. Why is everyone running during the entire film, and why is a car exploding every few minutes??!!
The movie is brainless action, but still manages to be boring. That's my review. Bye bye. Don't waste your time here. If you want to, your choice.
Ray Park v Lucy Liu was worth watching.  Doesn't deserve a 0.  This movie isn't over complicated.  Just an action movie to pass the time.
Honestly, you'll waste less time watchin' a better movie.
fresh not fake idk liked it lol
10/10... Im speechless, just such a beautiful film.
It was really bad but definitely not the worst movie ever made. There were a couple of clever things in it but not enough of them to warrant watching it as many times as I have.
don't watch this movie, do anything else: Play some games, go on a walk, watch better movies or even go and shit for 2 hours, that would be more entertaining than this awful movie
A startlingly inept film, "Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever" offers overblown, wall-to-wall action without a hint of wit, coherence, style, or originality.
If I could have given it a 0/5 stars, I would have.

Yes, I have to give at least a half-star for my review to be submitted, but believe me, this film sucks so much, it deserves The Flamin' Medallion Of True Terrible-Ness. Characters: 0/5 Story: 0/5 Acting: 0/5 Special Effects: 0/5 Direction: 0/5 Cinematography: 0/5 Soundtrack: 0/5 Overall: 0/5
Best movie I ever saw. Highly underrated.
All action with bullets flying. Good popcorn movie.

Meh, Some times when I'm on the computer and it comes on the TV, I'll leave it on it. Why not what the hell you know. Beats watching MTV all night, good to switch it up with a little TNT or TBS a little Superstation. At least that's how I felt about this movie when I had cable.
worst movie of history omg

This movie was a victim of its own hype.  The critics reviewed it far too harshly.  A 0%? Absolutely not. I would be upset if They gave it a 50%. This was an entertaining movie. There is no question about it. The idea that this is the worst movie of all time is absolutely ridiculous. I enjoyed it thoroughly through and through and the action was great the acting was great and I had a great time.  What do you want from an action movie? A cerebral character study? A plot with genius twists? No. You want action. This gives you action. It's well done.
it sucks dong big dong

This movie was a work of art. It was a true beauty and I cried 3 times during the movie because the character development and actions were so endearing. This was more than a movie. It was an experience. My life has been changed forever and I'll never look at the world in the same way because of this masterpiece.
Greatest movie ever!!!
Beefburger for the brain but without any flavour.
It's alright.  Not a 0% bad.
A half decent cast, but that is literally it!!
The title is misleading. The movie it average, the acting is average, the editing is average, sadly everything is average.

this movie is the perfect example of how far we've come with action scenes and specifically fight scenes. if you compare the fight scenes in this movie with something like daredevil tv series, it's absurd how big of a difference there is. rather than being fast, hard-hitting and intense, the fight scenes are slow and lack any kind of punch (pun). there is some creativity, but not much. as for the action scenes, basically useless, bunch of slomo explosions for the sake of explosions. lots of stupid parts. very outdated, like with the exaggerated fight sound effects from old movies. the musical score was very different and was pretty cool. the story was abhorant... i dunno if i'm using that word right but that's what came to mind. (2 viewings)
One of my favorite movies.  It's also a vehicle for technology of its day (nano robot) and info on China's one child policy.  The plot could've been taken from CIA Black-operations very easily.
I have no idea why this got such bad reviews. It's a really good action movie! Best line from Lucy "Some women buy shoes..."

Simply put: how did this happen?
More complex: how and why did Lucy Liu and Antonio banderas even bother taking part in this dump?

All I can say.
A victim of bandwagon jumping and, if watched with an honest eye, you'll see that this is an 80s-style action flick that works.

pretty sure NOBODY can act in this movie. Features guns, and more guns but zero plot, accent, theme - the filmmaker should have just made a confessional, genuine film about his life instead of this totally flat action film about the dangers of an Asian woman with a military assault rifle and eyeglasses. The film also has tacked on background music from, maybe, an infomercial or failed computer game.
O filme tem muitos erros, incluindo toda parte sonora, trilha, efeitos sonoros. Roteiro ... enfim.. Mas entretém, como uma ação pipoca.

yeah so its pretty bad. Not bad good just bad. Its not the suspension of disbelief that ruins the movie . Its the poor writing and amount of questions you'll be forced to ask. If your unforgiving its also the editing, and the way some of the scenes are set up.
One of the ffew movies I rented and then started to flip through channels, forgetting that I rented it. Incredibly boring, despite action at a high pace.
No worse than many other movies of this genre. Not enough dialoge for Lucy Liu was my biggest complaint. Action sequences were fine. Lucy Liu firing machine guns was gnarly. Whats not to like?
What can be said that hasn't already? Trash.
Very disappointed in this movie because is stars two really talented actors.
Encompassing the action of kidnapping and the intrigue of the FBI, this film is a must watch!
For the most reviewed 0% film, it is still so BAD!! I wouldn't show this thing to my worst enemies.
This film is a disaster. It deserves a 0% on Rotten Tomatoes.
It's not as bad as everyone says! (still bad tho)
Loved it when it came out, big fan of both stars and Talisa Soto got a second outing in it... =D
I liked the story and loved the explosion porn.
I loved this movie... don't care what the critics say!
i think half a star may be too much
Are you serious?  usually actor makes movies looks bad, this movie makes actors look bad.... No star saw this on my friends USB, wasted my time and disk space.
Plain, boorish, and the worst of all, my wallet got no refund.

3 words.

Worst Movie Ever.

Let's face it this film is bad. On paper it might have look like a good idea , like most films. but in the hands of these wo film makers the film take a total different dimension. coming from the martial movie world they have created a mixed of action film & mixed martial art spiced up with a bit of Matrix here and there but unfortunately the sauce doesn't really take and soon you have the feeling you are watching a series of fight shot back to back with no real story behind but for sure a great deal of insane stunts and a beautiful cast. It's an honest effort but it fails to reach any target originally intended. too bad because Banderas vs Liu is an exploding idea for a lead cast in such a film & it could have been epic.... maybe next time with the remake, the reboot or hell why not the sequel...

One of the dumbest high-budget poverties of imagination ever made, ECKS vs SEVER makes XXX: STATE OF THE UNION look like DIE HARD or THE FUGITIVE. This is the kind of arrogant garbage made by a nobody who comes from a third-world country where education is as rare as Xanadu. In this case, it's some guy from Thailand who calls himself Kaos. Yeah. That's the kind of movie you're getting here.
had potential in the cast

What a great movie. I can't believe that out of so many reviews noone has ever given this movie a positive review before. My family has a tradition, and every April 1st we all get together and watch Ecks vs Sever.
I liked it. Entertaining action,  A good dvd rental
My Favorite Action Film Is 1988's Die Hard.
I suppose this was a comedy film...
Can I give it 0 stars?
Clairement l'un des pires films d'action post-Matrix des débuts 2000!

I should hate this film. In some ways I wanted to. It's considered to be among the worst films ever made, it's really stupid, it feels like a big budget version of a low budget 80's action film, it's utterly ludicrous, convoluted in its storytelling, and just plain idiotic. But...I still liked it for all these stupid reasons. It's pure trash, but it was fun trash to me. I had a blast with this ridiculous film since I enjoyed the action scenes, I thought the acting was okay, I liked the music, and I think it's a lot of fun overall. I like my trash and this film is among my prized pieces of trash now. I liked it, but most will not.
An action movie this action packed should've been MUCH better. The most lackluster action I've seen since Steven Segal got fat.

'Ballistic' is inept. Did Ed Wood make this? He could have if he was given a jaw-dropping $70 million to produce horse s***. What were they thinking of? Didn't they have rushes? Were the producers high when they were viewing the dailies?? There is no excuse for this insulting garbage to exist. For shame.

For once, I disagree with every critic. Perfect music, the right kind of gloomy dark cast, and a gigantic deal of action while glorifying your enemy, Ecks vs. Sever is the most underrated movie I've ever seen, in which to me it's almost perfect.

I decided to watch this to experience how bad it was and holy shit IT WAS BAD.

EDIT: Added another half a star just because this isn't the load of crap that is "Alone in the Dark".
Not a bad action flick, but Liu is really the only good thing to see here.
This is a shockingly incompetent exercise in bloated, nonstop action - artless, humorless, incoherent, and unimaginative.

Banderas and Liu saved this film from deserving the rating it got here on IMDb. The film is certainly pointless, loaded with ridiculous plot twists and absurd action sequences, but how many action films don't fit this description? Seriously, if you want to see what two entertaining actors and a lot of wasted film can do together, this film is worth a look. it's plot heavy, bit soul-less and clichéd, but entertaining nonetheless.

I turned it on at 3AM one sleepless night because I wanted to see what the heck Liu and Banderas were doing in a direct to video film. Expecting a thoroughly dreadful film, I was pleasantly surprised, and found the film to be entertaining. The film views like a series of strung together early-80s MTV videos with a contemporary hard rock sound track, plenty of loud noises and explosions, and, thankfully, few words.

To the extent that I remember it, the plot was about Banderas trying to rescue his wife and son from the clutches of some very evil super-secret spy types (who are nevertheless apparently exceedingly inept). A lot of stuff got blown up - in fact most of the sets were heavily rigged with explosives which seemed to go off at random intervals. Of course there were a lot of gunshots, fists, and kicks. I don't recall any swords or phasers though. If I say anything about Lucy Liu at all, I will give away the rest of the plot (which ought to tell you something about the quality of the script and the complexity of the plot) Lighten up! It's bad, but it's just a B movie. And this is what B movies are supposed to be about. By the way, a better choice for an utterly stupid action/violence flick is the masterpiece of violence surrealism "Mean Guns"
Why can't the star meter go LOWER than this?

I hate to admit that I own this movie but I keep it to remind me of the mistake I made in purchasing it. Especially since I watched it for the first time as a rental but didn't actually watch it but rather had it on, multitasked and assumed it was good because I heard and saw random action scenes but didn't pay attention as to how stupid it all was. Shame on me.
Gets 1/2 star only because of Lucy Liu being in it. A complete of waste of time and money spent on the rental.
Clumsy in every possible way.
Yet another generic techno blow em' up storyless action flop starring two has-beens Antonio Banderas and Lucy Liu...it's a joke.
What do they think this is. It ain't entertainment that's for sure
Far away the worst movie ever!!!!!!!

Directed by Thai director Wych Kaosayananda, who is credited as Kaos, and written by Alan McElroy (Rapid Fire (1992) and Wrong Turn (2003)), this is an action thriller that got universally panned at the time, and has been credited as one of the worst films ever made, but it's NOT. It's actually a quite enjoyable and action packed film taking a brilliant advantage of filming in a brilliant location. Former FBI agent Jeremiah Ecks (Antonio Banderas) is assigned by the Defense Intelligence Agency to help find the kidnapped son of the agency's director Robert Gant (Greg Henry), the son Michael (Aidan Drummond) was kidnapped after a trip away to Berlin. They find that the former DIA agent named Sever (Lucy Liu), and after a huge shootout in downtown Vancouver, Sever escapes, but Ecks learns that Gant stole a nanobot and has smuggled it back from Berlin by putting it in Michael's body. Gant's wife Vinn (Talisa Soto) was married to Ecks a few years previously, and Gant separated them by making one another think they were killed in car bombs, but Ecks soon finds himself in league with Sever to try and put a stop to Gant's plan. Yes, it is a very silly film with a ridiculous plot, but it has some brilliant action sequences throughout, and one or two good chase scenes, all filmed in Vancouver in locations including the Public Library, Stanley Park and the Aquarium, which seldom get seen on film. It's not perfect, but it's certainly not as bad as what the critics made it out to be at the time. There are FAR WORSE films than this one.

I wanted to gave kaos a credit of had a good will of making thai hollywood movie.
Unfortunately Hollywood and Thai Director don't mixed well and turned this movie to gave its real star of all,explosions.

I hate it when they make a movie look good in the previews and then it just flops in the theatres. This was one of them. It was like they used all the actions scenes for the preview and then the rest of the movie was fluff. The story wasn't even gripping enough to make it worth seeing a second time.
Disappointing to say the least
Antonio Banderas and Lucy Liu chase each other through a hail of bullets, broken glass and pointless explosions in this borderline nonsensical action flick.
I seriously can't believe I saw this in theaters. 90 minutes and 9 bucks wasted. Awful performances, no plot, lame action sequences.
looks cool, but it's just another halfway idea slapped on the screen that could have easily been told without sound.

A much maligned film, and unfairly so I think. Great action scenes, explosions, shoot-outs, martial arts fighting all set to a good soundtrack. Plot was not as bad as many made it seem. One of my favorite action flicks from the past decade.

Not sure what the huge portions of hate are all about. Granted their really is very little story (and the story that is there is absurd) but action is realistic enough to not be insulting and the money spent on production made it look enough like an A grade film to merit at least on good comment among the 100 horrible reviews. Again Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever isn't great nor is it really good but it is better than the rap it has been given.
A fantastic film, superb acting and direction. Simply boggles my mind that this wasn't nominated for an Oscar.
Nothing but action. No coherent plot or character development or premise behind it. Just pointless action.
An absurdly shit movie. Bad acting, bad plot... even the action was bad and this movie was simply action!
great special effects
Director of this so called action film is called kaos. How fitting.
just not a very good movie... that's about all i'll say about it

I remember seeing this back in high school with some friends and thinking it was the worst movie I had ever seen. 10 years later, it's tough to say whether or not I've seen a weaker movie than this.

This movie can be summed up quite easily - take a nonsensical back story (Awkward tension filled dinner at fancy restaurant takes a turn for the worst when wife/mom/whatever gets in her car and it blows up!) and mix it in with loud, ear piercing gun fire sound effects and a S*** TON OF EXPLOSIVES! And I DO mean a s*** ton.

The action scenes actually manage to get boring. And every time you think you're bored to tears from it, they blow up something else. (As you can imagine, that happens a lot.)

I don't quite remember what I was expecting to see. I guess I was expecting to see some real ass kicking between Ecks and Sever going at it, but no no no...That all ends not even 3 quarters of the movie when, spoiler alert, they join forces. Yes. No longer VS anymore. 

Does that even matter at this point? Not to mention that the characters in the movie do absolutely nothing to make you give a damn about them or what's happening in the film. No commitment from either stars, Banderas or Liu. Forget the rest of the cast, or the fact that Talisa Soto is only known for playing Kitana in the Mortal Kombat movies and nothing else. Okay, that was a tangent. Sorry.

This movie sucks. Having written this review now, I can see I have put forth more effort into this than anyone who had anything to do with Ecks VS Sever. F*** my life.
At 0% after more than 100 reviews, Rotten Tomatoes has referred to Ballistic as the worst film ever reviewed on their site.  I may have to agree with them.
If you can bare more than 5 minutes of this film then my only conclusion would be that you do not have a normal functioning human brain.

If a movieâ(TM)s first 33 minutes is nothing but mayhem, can it be classified as a movie or a video game?
Even a decent video game is more exciting than this. So meaningless is the finale showdown, it is almost an insult to oneâ(TM)s intelligence. Whatâ(TM)s the use to detonate bombs distance away from the enemiesâ(TM) position? After flashing all possible types of guns and revolvers exist in the world, why toss them away for a body combat? The killing of the antagonist is always the piece de resistance of any movie. Not here in this movie. Blink your eyes and youâ(TM)ll miss it.  My advice: Donâ(TM)t waste your time on this.
horrible horrible movie.
Antonio Banderas and Lucy Liu chase each other through a hail of bullets, broken glass and pointless explosions in this borderline nonsensical action flick.
Bad, but I've seen way worse movies. I don't know why all this hate.

I really want to say I liked this as it did have some kinda cool action scenes in but they don't make up for the rest of the film sadly. Most of the camera work is really poor, and for me to notice that says a lot in itself. The pretty weak storyline doesn't really help either not explaining some things properly to even give you a chance to get enthralled in the story (It is possible I drifted off and missed some of the storyline).

Before watching this, the worst movie I've ever seen was the comedic travesty that was Epic Movie, but after this, I honestly don't know which was worse. The first problem that exists throughout the movie is the awful techno soundtrack which might be one of the worst I've ever heard in a movie. It had the aforementioned techno, the random woman singing, or both. As for the acting, it was so bad that I was more entertained by some of the extras in one of the action scenes than any of the paid actors. Even the action wasn't very good. The sequences of gunfights and explosions ranged from annoying to boring to ridiculously absurd, but none of them were exciting.

But the worst thing of all is the story, which doesn't really exist. There are supposedly explanations for the shootouts, but none of them make any sense and none of them made me care about the characters, their situations or their existence. I spent a lot of time wondering why all these stupid events by these stupid characters are even going on. I could probably write a better movie than this, it is that bad. There was nothing done right in this movie at all, and I doubt I'll see another movie this bad for a long time.

A total unoriginal premise. Terrible lines and acting. Things in it just don't make sense!!! The CIA headquarters is located in Ontario, Canada. What? Do you have no brains? About 2 vaguely interesting actions sequences can't make up for thoughtless production, crappy writing and awful directing.
All explosions and no story, yet the film even manages to fail completely at that. At least The Hurt Locker had good acting in it.
Yea. It was bad... I didn't think it was even remotely good. From the first scene when the director called himself "Chaos", you knew this wasn't like any other movie.
